content: I need to refer to all NDC codes in one of my IGuides and I'm surprised that there isn't an implicit value set for NDC. I expected there would be one since this seems like a common value set and is similar to the implicit value set we have for RxNorm. Is it due to the fact that there isn't a proper means to determine the expansion according to the version issues note?
I don't understand this question. What kind of implicit value set do you want?
I presume a value for CodeSystem.valueSet for the NDC CodeSystem?
oh right. that's not an implicit value set. But it would be good to know that that is, yes

Sorry, I misread the RxNorm page. On the RxNorm page it has the following:

Implicit Value Sets
Implicit value sets are those whose specification can be predicted based on the grammar of the underlying code system, and the known structure of the URL that refers to them. At the time of this publication, RxNorm does not define implicit value sets.

The identifier http://www.nlm.nih.gov/research/umls/rxnorm/vs represents a value set that contains all RxNorm CUIs.

I was looking for something similar for NDC codes:

http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/ndc/vs
we don't really have a policy but I don't think we have sub-identifiers in any existing sids
What's the "sub-identifier" in this case? I think Jean just needs the "all codes" value set url for NDC.
vs is a sub-identifier to ndc in this case

Rob Hausam said:

What's the "sub-identifier" in this case? I think Jean just needs the "all codes" value set url for NDC.

Yes, in the end of the day, that's actually what I want - the "all NDC codes" value set. :)
